solution.text:
As the diagonals of the rhombus are equal to its side, and all the sides of a rhombus are also equal, the rhombus forms two equilateral triangles separated by its diagonal.
Thus the angle of the equilateral triangle is \(60^o\), and the angle consisting of the diagonal is \(60+60=120^o\)

content.text: One of the diagonals of a rhombus and its sides are equal. Find the angles of the rhombus.
